results.title: Soundscape
results.creator_credit: Adele Sztar and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experiment in creative and psychological communication using audio-visual relationships which are progressively abstracted: it begins by presenting images and sounds in our environment. The images become abstracted and the sounds are manipulated by the use of electronic music. Made by a music teacher for teachers and students of music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adele Sztar and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.description: An experiment in creative and psychological communication using audio-visual relationships which are progressively abstracted: it begins by presenting images and sounds in our environment. results.title: Sound waves and their sources
results.brief_description: Demonstrates and explains several types of sound sources. Their characteristics, such as frequency, amplitude, wave length and harmonies are explained visually.

results.title: Sound waves
results.creator_credit: S.G. Fergusson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows typical examples of transverse and longitudinal wave motions to be found in nature; illustrates by diagrams the relationship between wave-length, frequency and velocity for transverse and longitudinal waves; the familiar bell-jar experiment demonstrates the necessity of a medium for the transmission of sound waves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: S.G. Fergusson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Sound recording for motion pictures
results.brief_description: Portrays the work of the motion picture soundman in arranging the set and recording acceptable sync-sound on location. Contrasts the advantages of a sound studio and the problems inherent in recording on location. Discusses three major recording problems and their solutions - accoustical treatment of set, choice and placement of microphone, and controlling unwanted noise including electrical hum in recording equipment.
results.description: Portrays the work of the motion picture soundman in arranging the set and recording acceptable sync-sound on location. results.title: Soulmate
results.creator_credit: Lincoln Douglas Hiatt, Fair Dinkum and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Motifs of water and innocence lost abound in this short film about a troubled adult, Jordan, who is plagued by an image from childhood of a woman in red. Cast includes David Gray, Kim Trengrove and Timothy Fox. Music by David Bridie.

results.title: Soulcaking at Antrobus
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Every year at Hallwe’en a gang of men from the village of Antrobus in Cheshire perform a traditional play in the pubs and village halls of the neighbourhood. The film shows a performance at the Wheatsheaf, Antrobus on 12th November 1974, and tries to demonstrate what lies behind it
